title: Correct documentation, names and use for the BuiltinNet API
body:
After speaking with @zasdfgbnm today he told me that the idea is that the BuiltinNet class is private and the user only accesses ANI1x, ANI1ccx, etc.

I think it would be best then to: 
1) Make all methods and attributes in BuiltinNet private except for **forward**, **ase**, **species_to_tensor**, **__getitem__**, **__len__**, by renaming them with a leading underscore.

2) Properly document ANI1ccx and ANI1x to reflect the usage in the classes, and probably add some more details. 

Also, right now BuiltinNet still behaves in a kind of strange way and it may be good to refactor it:

## Refactoring Builtin API

BuiltinNet is a sequential torchani model that has inside:

AEVComputer -> Ensemble -> EnergyShifter

Indexing BuiltinNet (as in BuiltinNet[0]) outputs a sequential object that has inside:

AEVComputer -> ANIModel -> EnergyShifter 

But there is no built in class for that object, I think this is not very user friendly and kind of confusing, also, the name "BuiltinNet" is not descriptive, the previous name, "BuiltinModels" was also not descriptive.

It is probably a good idea to refactor this before it gets more confusing. A possibility is

AEVComputer -> Ensemble -> EnergyShifter in a **NNPEnsemble class** instead of BuiltinNet
AEVComputer -> ANIModel -> EnergyShifter in a new **NNPModel class** 

ANI1x and ANIccx inherit from **NNPEnsemble** 
The individual models inside ANI1x and ANIccx are **NNPModel**

This is descriptive since "NNP" is something that is used to calculate QM energies that make sense from distances, so it is intuitive that if I have an "NNP" object I can use this directly for calculations.

Ensemble and ANIModel should probably also be renamed. to reflect the fact that they only take in AEV and output a thing that is not really a good QM energy because it hasn't been shifted.

I recommend something like **ANIModule** and **ANIModuleEnsemble**

This way we would have:

AEVComputer -> **ANIModuleEnsemble** -> EnergyShifter in **NNPEnsemble**
AEVComputer -> **ANIModule** -> EnergyShifter in **NNPModel** 

I would make this a project instead of an issue but I don't really know how to =)
